current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to require States with failed American
			 Health Benefit Exchanges to reimburse the Federal Government for amounts
			 provided under grants for the establishment and operation of such
			 Exchanges.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended
			 by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1311(a) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:a

header.#text: Reimbursing the Federal Government for failed State Exchange grants

text.#text:
In the case of a State that has received one or more establishment or early innovator grants under
			 this subsection and which
			 operated a State-based Exchange in program year 2014, if such State 
			 subsequently elects to provide solely	for the enrollment of its residents
			 in
			 qualified health plans through the Federally Facilitated Exchange, such
			 State shall reimburse the Federal Government for the aggregate amounts
			 provided to the State under such grant or grants.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
such reimbursement be made,  in full, within the 10-year period beginning on the date on which the
			 State makes the election described in

that the State make an annual payment in an amount equal to 10 percent of the total
			 amount provided to the State under the grant or grants awarded to the
			 State under this subsection.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that, at a minimum, shall require that—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Department
			 of Health and Human Services

text.#text:
Reimbursement shall be provided to the Federal Government by a State under this paragraph pursuant
			 to the terms of an agreement entered into by the State and the

The Federal Government shall not reduce the amount of the reimbursement required to be provided by
			 a State under this paragraph.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that fails to enter into an agreement under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:a/p:6/sp:A
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:a/p:6/sp:B

			 State under

for each of the 10 fiscal

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
by the State. The amount of
			 each such reduction  shall be uniform and shall in the aggregate equal the
			 total amount of the reimbursement required under this paragraph.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:a/p:6/sp:A

text.#text: In the case of a State described in

Amounts paid by a State under this section shall be placed in the General Fund of the Treasury to
			 be used for deficit reduction.
